newsitem.title: USA: FirstCity extends offer for preferred shrs.
newsitem.headline: FirstCity extends offer for preferred shrs.

text.p: FirstCity Financial Corp said it is extending the expiration of its exchange offer for its special preferred stock July 31.
The exchange lets holders of outstanding special preferred stock exchange their shares for an equal number of FirstCity's redeemable new preferred stock.

The redemption value of the new preferred stock will be $21, and the stock will have an annual dividend rate of $3.15 per share, payable quarterly, until September 30, 1998, after which it will go down to $2.10 per year or 10 percent of the new preferred redemption value, FirstCity said.
The new preferred will be callable on or after September 30, 2003 and is to be redeemed September 30, 2005.
Consummation of the exchange remains conditioned upon, among other things, at least 1.5 million special preferred shares being validly tendered.
As of Friday, July 18, 935,000 shares had been tendered, FirstCity said.
